trans-unit.source: Below is a complete list of the user defined functions available in AutoIt. Click on a user defined function name for a detailed description.

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_ExcludeClipRect

target.mrk: _WinAPI_ExcludeClipRect

trans-unit.source: Creates a new clipping region that consists of the existing clipping region minus the specified rectangle

seg-source.mrk: Creates a new clipping region that consists of the existing clipping region minus the specified rectangle

target.mrk: Creates a new clipping region that consists of the existing clipping region minus the specified rectangle

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_ExtSelectClipRgn

target.mrk: _WinAPI_ExtSelectClipRgn

trans-unit.source: Combines the specified region with the current clipping region

seg-source.mrk: Combines the specified region with the current clipping region

target.mrk: Combines the specified region with the current clipping region

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_GetClipBox

target.mrk: _WinAPI_GetClipBox

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the visible area

target.mrk: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the visible area

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_GetClipRgn

target.mrk: _WinAPI_GetClipRgn

trans-unit.source: Retrieves a handle identifying the current application-defined clipping region

target.mrk: Retrieves a handle identifying the current application-defined clipping region

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_IntersectClipRect

target.mrk: _WinAPI_IntersectClipRect

trans-unit.source: Creates a new clipping region from the intersection of the current clipping region and the specified rectangle

seg-source.mrk: Creates a new clipping region from the intersection of the current clipping region and the specified rectangle

target.mrk: Creates a new clipping region from the intersection of the current clipping region and the specified rectangle

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_OffsetClipRgn

target.mrk: _WinAPI_OffsetClipRgn

trans-unit.source: Moves the clipping region of a device context by the specified offsets

target.mrk: Moves the clipping region of a device context by the specified offsets

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_PtVisible

target.mrk: _WinAPI_PtVisible

trans-unit.source: Determines whether the specified point is within the clipping region

target.mrk: Determines whether the specified point is within the clipping region

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_RectVisible

target.mrk: _WinAPI_RectVisible

trans-unit.source: Determines whether any part of the specified rectangle lies within the clipping region

target.mrk: Determines whether any part of the specified rectangle lies within the clipping region

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_SelectClipPath

target.mrk: _WinAPI_SelectClipPath

trans-unit.source: Selects the current path as a clipping region, combining the new region with any existing clipping region

target.mrk: Selects the current path as a clipping region, combining the new region with any existing clipping region

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_SelectClipRgn

target.mrk: _WinAPI_SelectClipRgn

trans-unit.source: Selects a region as the current clipping region for the specified device context
